Description: Control-FREEC is a tool for detection of copy-number changes and allelic imbalances (including LOH) using deep-sequencing data originally developed by the Bioinformatics Laboratory of Institut Curie (Paris). It automatically computes, normalizes, segments copy number and beta allele frequency (BAF) profiles, then calls copy number alterations and LOH.
EDAM operation: Copy number estimation, Variant calling, Genome alignment
EDAM topic: DNA structural variation, Oncology, Human genetics, Data mining
bio.tool description: A tool for control-free copy number alteration (CNA) and allelic imbalances (LOH) detection using deep-sequencing data, particularly useful for cancer studies.
